title: Bicycle motion:tabular and analytical part - c

content.question: For 0≤t≤4 hours, Ruth's velocity can be modeled by the function <math> <semantics> <mi>g</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGNbaaaa@39E8@</annotation> </semantics> </math> given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>24</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>5</mn> <mi>sin</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>0.7</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B56@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. According to the model, what was Ruth's average velocity during the time interval 0≤t≤4 ?

frqParts.text: For 0≤t≤4 hours, Ruth's velocity can be modeled by the function <math> <semantics> <mi>g</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGNbaaaa@39E8@</annotation> </semantics> </math> given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>24</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>5</mn> <mi>sin</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>0.7</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B56@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. According to the model, what was Ruth's average velocity during the time interval 0≤t≤4 ?

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
